intro: Matelea nummularia, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silver-gray, velvety foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy stems and lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. The plant's unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
